column17: The grenade was thrown at the festival that was occurring in Chisinua. The exact location is unknown.
column18: 10/14/2009: On Wednesday, the investigative group determined the Party of Communists' faction threw a grenade during the festive events that were occurring in Chisinau, Moldova; 39 people were injured. This is related to the Prime Minister receiving threatening phone calls as well as the security at the event was not properly maintained and the Interior Minister Viktor Katan must resign.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: A grenade was used in this attack.
column108: It is unknown if the attack caused any property damage.
column126: Interfax, �Blast in Chisinau Was a Terror Attack,� Interfax, October 15, 2009.
column128: \"\"Forty-One Civilians Injured in Grenade Attack in Chisinau"
column133: �Wednesday Blast in Chisinau Was Caused by Grenade - Interior Minister

column18: 06/19/2012: An explosive device was discovered and defused along the route of a presidential motorcade in Bender city, Bender province, Moldova. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the device was planted along the scheduled route of the Transnistrian presidential motorcade.  The motorcade would have been traveling to participate in the 20th anniversary of the Bender incident that occurred on June 19, 1992 and marked the end of the Moldovan-Transnistrian War.
column97: An explosive device consisting of 400 grams of TNT was used in the attack.
column129: 2012.\",\"\"\"TNT blocks found on Transdniestrian presidential motorcade's route"
